snippet: Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, who was accused of sexually harassing multiple female employees, said he would resign and instead run for New York City Council.
abstract: New York State Assemblyman Vito J Lopez, who was accused of sexually harassing multiple female employees, says he will resign and instead run for New York City Council; his determination to run for the Council serves as reminder of the extraordinary staying power of incumbents in New York.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY
byline.contributor: David W. Chen and Javier C. Hernández contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, who was accused of sexually harassing multiple female employees, said he would resign and instead run for New York City Council.

headline.seo: Legislator in Harassment Case to Quit Albany but Not Politics
headline.main: State Legislator Facing Expulsion Says He’ll Resign
headline.print_headline: State Legislator Facing Expulsion Says He’ll Resign
